Systems Biology Workbench (SBW)
 PREV CLASS   NEXT CLASS FRAMES    NO FRAMES
SUMMARY:  INNER | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL:  FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

edu.caltech.sbw
Class SBW

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--edu.caltech.sbw.SBW
public final class SBW
extends java.lang.Object

This class provides various general-purpose methods for such things as connecting/disconnecting from SBW, obtaining module instances, and searching for services. All of the methods on this class are static.

Version:
$Revision: 1.7 $
Author:
Andrew Finney, Michael Hucka, $Author: mhucka $

Method Detail

connect

public static void connect()
                    throws SBWCommunicationException,
                           SBWBrokerStartException
Connect to SBW as a client, indicating that this application does not provide any services. The connection is anonymous. Other modules querying the Broker for what is connected to SBW will be informed that a module is connected, but without a name or other information.

A client must connect to SBW before performing other operations such as querying the system for services.

Throws:
SBWCommunicationException - if a communication error occurs or this client is already connected to SBW

connect

public static void connect(java.lang.String hostNameOrAddress)
                    throws SBWCommunicationException,
                           SBWBrokerStartException
DEPRECATED; the introduction of proper networked distributed operation in SBW version 1.0 makes this method obsolete. Programs should always connect to their local Broker using connect() and connect multiple Brokers together using link(String hostNameOrAddess). Connects (as a client) to the SBW Broker running on the host computer identified by the host name or IP address in hostNameOrAddress. The connection is anonymous and the Broker is informed that this application does not provide any services. Other modules querying the Broker for what is connected to SBW will be informed that a module is connected, but without a name or other information.

This is a variation on the plain connect() method described elsewhere.

Note that a client can only be connected to one SBW Broker at a time. Attempting to connect multiple times will result in an exception.

Parameters:
hostNameOrAddress - the host name or IP address to connect to
Throws:
SBWCommunicationException - if a communication error occurs or this client is already connected to SBW

link

public static void link(java.lang.String hostNameOrAddress)
                 throws SBWBrokerStartException,
                        SBWCommunicationException
Tells the local SBW Broker to connect to another SBW Broker running on a remote computer, starting the remote Broker first if necessary. The remote host is identified by the host name or IP address in hostNameOrAddress.

Parameters:
hostNameOrAddress - the host name or IP address to connect to
Throws:
SBWCommunicationException - if a communication error occurs or this client is already connected to SBW
SBWBrokerStartException - if the remote Broker cannot be started up

disconnect

public static void disconnect()
Notifies SBW that this application will no longer be providing or consuming services. Invoking this method will first send a notification message to the Broker, then close the network socket and terminate the thread handling message processing. If any errors are encountered while notifying the Broker or closing the socket, no exceptions are raised and all of the operations are still performed.

getModuleInstance

public static Module getModuleInstance(java.lang.String moduleName)
                                throws SBWCommunicationException,
                                       SBWModuleStartException,
                                       SBWModuleNotFoundException
Returns an instance of the given module. If the module instance has management type ModuleImpl.UNIQUE, then a Module object corresponding to an existing module instance is returned. Otherwise, a new module instance is launched by the SBW Broker. A new instance is always launched if no existing instance exists.

Various unusual conditions may lead to exceptions. These include: null module names, inability to contact the broker, inability to start the requested module, etc.

Parameters:
moduleName - the unique name of the module
Returns:
a Module object representing the module instance
Throws:
SBWModuleNotFoundException - if the module named moduleName is null or the module is unknown to the Broker
SBWModuleStartException - if an error occurs while attempting to start the requested module
SBWCommunicationException - if a communication error occurs

getExistingModuleInstances

public static Module[] getExistingModuleInstances()
                                           throws SBWCommunicationException
Returns an array of Module objects corresponding to every module connected to the system at this time.

Returns:
an array of Module object instances
Throws:
SBWCommunicationException - if there is a problem contacting the SBW Broker

getExistingModuleInstances

public static Module[] getExistingModuleInstances(java.lang.String name)
                                           throws SBWCommunicationException
Returns an array of Module objects corresponding to every running module that has the given module unique name. (Multiple instances of a module may be running if the module does not have management type ModuleImpl.UNIQUE and multiple client modules have requested instances.)

Parameters:
name - the name of the module
Returns:
an array of Module object instances
Throws:
SBWCommunicationException - if there is a problem contacting the SBW Broker

getModuleDescriptors

public static ModuleDescriptor[] getModuleDescriptors(boolean includeRunning)
                                               throws SBWCommunicationException
Returns an array of ModuleDescriptor objects corresponding to all modules known to the local SBW Broker. If the boolean flag includeRunning is false, only registered modules will be included (since those are the only kinds of modules for which the Broker will have registration information). If the flag is true, this method additionally includes running module instances. The difference in behavior is relevant when there are unregistered modules connected to SBW: when includeRunning is false, unregistered modules are not included in the array of module descriptors returned.

Parameters:
includeRunning - whether to include modules that may be running unregistered
Returns:
an array of ModuleDescriptor object instances
Throws:
SBWCommunicationException - if there is a problem contacting the SBW Broker

getModuleDescriptors

public static ModuleDescriptor[] getModuleDescriptors(boolean includeRunning,
                                                      boolean localOnly)
                                               throws SBWCommunicationException
Returns an array of ModuleDescriptor objects corresponding to all modules known to SBW. If the boolean flag includeRunning is false, only registered modules will be included (since those are the only kinds of modules for which the Broker will have registration information). If the flag is true, this method additionally includes running module instances. The difference in behavior is relevant when there are unregistered modules connected to SBW: when includeRunning is false, unregistered modules are not included in the array of module descriptors returned.

The second flag localOnly specifies whether to include only local modules or all modules in a network of interacting SBW Brokers. If the flag is true, the module descriptors returned refer only to the local broker; if the flag is false, information from all connected brokers is included in the module descriptor list.

Parameters:
includeRunning - whether to include modules that may be running unregistered
localOnly - whether to include only modules on the local broker or all known brokers.
Returns:
an array of ModuleDescriptor object instances
Throws:
SBWCommunicationException - if there is a problem contacting the SBW Broker

getModuleDescriptor

public static ModuleDescriptor getModuleDescriptor(java.lang.String moduleName)
                                            throws SBWModuleNotFoundException,
                                                   SBWBrokerStartException,
                                                   SBWCommunicationException
Returns a ModuleDescriptor object corresponding to the module whose unique name is given as the first argument.

Parameters:
moduleName - the module name
Returns:
an array of ModuleDescriptor object instances
Throws:
SBWCommunicationException - if there is a problem contacting the SBW Broker

findServices

public static ServiceDescriptor[] findServices(java.lang.String category,
                                               boolean recursive)
                                        throws SBWCommunicationException,
                                               SBWIncorrectCategorySyntaxException
Returns an array of ServiceDescriptor objects corresponding to all of the services registered with SBW in the given category. The boolean flag recursive indicates whether the search should be performed recursively through the service hierarchy. If true, the string category is matched against all categories and subcategories. An example use of this method might be to use the category "Analysis" to query for all the services which provide analyses of SBML models.

Parameters:
category - the category of services to search for
recursive - whether to search recursively through the service hierarchy starting from the point indicated by category
Throws:
SBWCommunicationException - if there is a problem contacting the SBW Broker
SBWIncorrectCategorySyntaxException - if the string category has incorrect syntax

getServiceCategories

public static java.lang.String[] getServiceCategories(java.lang.String parentCategory)
                                               throws SBWCommunicationException,
                                                      SBWIncorrectCategorySyntaxException
Returns an array of strings listing all of the immediate subcategories of the given parameter parentCategory. An empty string as the value of parentCategory stands for the root of the hierarchy tree; thus, getServiceCategories("") returns an array of the top-level categories known to SBW.

Parameters:
parentCategory - the category for which to search for subcategories
Returns:
an array of strings listing the known subcategories of the given argument
Throws:
SBWCommunicationException - if an error occurs trying to contact the SBW Broker
SBWIncorrectCategorySyntaxException - if there is an error in the syntax of the given category pathname parentCategory

getVersion

public static java.lang.String getVersion()
returns the version of this client library

getBrokerVersion

public static java.lang.String getBrokerVersion()
                                         throws SBWCommunicationException
returns the version of the broker

getSBWHome

public static java.io.File getSBWHome()
Returns the path to the home directory of the SBW installation.

Returns:
a File object corresponding to the SBW home directory

addListener

public static void addListener(SBWListener listener)
Adds the given listener object to the list of listeners that SBW will call when certain events occur. ("SBW Listeners" are used in SBW to notify an application of certain events such as module startups and shutdowns.)

The order in which listeners are called is unspecified.

Parameters:
listener - the SBWListener object to add to the list of listeners for special events
See Also:
SBWListener

removeListener

public static void removeListener(SBWListener listener)
Removes the given listener object from the list of listeners that SBW calls when certain events occur. ("SBW Listeners" are used in SBW to notify an application of certain events such as module startups and shutdowns.)

Parameters:
listener - the SBWListener object to add to the list of listeners for special events
See Also:
SBWListener

getThisModule

public static Module getThisModule()
Returns a Module object corresponding to the current module instance.

Returns:
a Module object

getLowLevelAPI

public static SBWLowLevel getLowLevelAPI()
Returns an object implementing the SBWLowLevel interface for the low-level SBW API.

Returns:
an SBWLowLevel object
